title: Container
content:
Hello

Why is dealing with container is so hard? I mean it's like peoples who design it don't use it, there is a lot of design flaw in it (like when it ask wich container to use but you can't select no container so firefox will purposelessly force you to be tracked by Google or Facebook, it make no sense at all).

And more globally, firefox brag to be about privacy, but for the end user like me there is to much design error to make it easy to use (we can't make inactive an extension from the browser, we always have to go to these menus it's really boring and in the end you stop using privacy module because of this)

I think Firefox should not be about privacy on paper only but really designed to be practical about privacy and I think it's not going good and most peoples will end to don't care about privacy because of this (and switch to chrome or else).

Oh and I will be pleased to help and give more detailed informations about all those design problems, and how they occur, to fix them and improve Fx.

But I won't continue to use Fx is the main reason to use it now : the privacy settings, are not easily usable in everyday's life.

Regards
creator: jsr3

title: Windows on screen keyboard not triggered in text fields
content:
When using Surface Go without physical keyboard attached, tapping on the Firefox address bar or text fields in web pages should trigger on-screen keyboard to appear. Works in other browsers on the same device, but not Firefox 77.

Annoying workaround is: long-press to force context menu to appear, screen keyboard also appears, cancel context menu, start typing.

title: Win.MxResIcn.Heur.Gen
content: Hi. I'm using Linux Mint 20. I wanted to go back to Windows 10. Under Linux I downloaded the latest version of Firefox. I checked the installation file on the VirusTotal page. VirusTotal showed that the exe file contains the Win.MxResIcn.Heur.Gen trojan and the msi file contains Attention.APT-Bait.ContainShellCode! 1.9E28. Earlier installation files also contained some surprises. I don't think my Linux system contains any viruses. Installations of other browsers such as Opera or Chrome do not have these "add-ons". Interestingly, if I paste the link to the installation file into VirusTotal - there are no surprises. What is going on?
creator: lucas11

title: Firefox 78 slow download after win 10 july update
content:
Firefox 78.0.2 win 10 2004 / 19041.388 Device Security / Core Isolation / Memory Integrity = ON Win 10 July Update KB4565627 & KB4565503

Testing using https://www.xfinityspeedtest.org Similar results with https://tesymy.net

Before this update Firefox / Chrome / Edge all reported approximately the same download speed. ~500Mb After the update Chrome & Edge still report similar download speed ~500 Mb but Firefox is about half. ~270Mb

Upload seems to be unchanged at ~17Mb.

If I turn Memory Integrity off, Fire Fox download returns to previous operation.

So far only Fire Fox seems to be impacted by these changes.
creator: paulf1801

title: Search bar/Address bar Not Working
content:
Starting yesterday, I noticed my search/address bar no longer works right. When I type a search term or web address into the bar and hit the enter key, nothing happens. Nothing happens when I click the "go" arrow on the righthand edge of the bar either.

When I first click on the bar, a menu pops up below it and one of the options is "search with Google". If I click this option, it puts @google at the beginning of the bar, and search works just fine. But this extra step is irritating, and it doesn't work to take me directly to a website. For example to get to Pinterest, instead of typing pinterest.com in the bar and going directly there, I have to type "@google pinterest", and click on the first search result.

I read some past topics addressing this question, and have tried clearing my cache, refreshing Firefox, and restarting Firefox in SafeMode. None of these have helped (and even in SafeMode I still had the same problem). Any other suggestions would be much appreciated.
